perturbation.original_text:
Any notice, instruction, direction or demand under the terms of this Agreement required to be in writing shall be duly given upon delivery, if delivered by hand, facsimile transmission, or mail, to the following addresses:

To Morgan Stanley & Co. Incorporated:

Morgan Stanley 1585 Broadway New York, NY 10036 Attn: Martin M. Cohen, Director of Company Law Facsimile: (212) 507-3334

To MSCI:

MSCl Inc. 88 Pine Street New York, New York 10005 Attn: General Counsel Facsimile: (212) 804-2906

or to such other addresses or telecopy numbers as may be specified by like notice to the other party. All such notices, requests and other communications shall be deemed given, (a) when delivered in person or by courier or a courier services, (b) if sent by facsimile transmission (receipt confirmed) on a business day prior to 5 p.m. in the place of receipt, on the date of transmission (or, if sent after 5 p.m., on the following business day) or (c) if mailed by certified mail (return receipt requested), on the date specified on the return receipt.
perturbation.changed_text:
Any notice, instruction, direction or demand under the terms of this Agreement required to be in writing shall be duly given upon delivery, if delivered by hand, facsimile transmission, or mail, to the following addresses:

To Morgan Stanley & Co. Incorporated:

Morgan Stanley 1585 Broadway New York, NY 10036 Attn: Martin M. Cohen, Director of Company Law Facsimile: (212) 507-3334

To MSCI:

MSCl Inc. 88 Pine Street New York, New York 10005 Attn: General Counsel Facsimile: (212) 804-2906

or to such other addresses or telecopy numbers as may be specified by like notice to the other party. All such notices, requests and other communications shall be deemed given, (a) when delivered in person or by courier or a courier services, (b) if sent by facsimile transmission (receipt confirmed) within 7 days of the transmission being sent or (c) if mailed by standard mail, 90 days after the item has been sent.
perturbation.explanation: The changes to the notice clause create inconsistencies regarding when notices are deemed given. Specifically, the modification stating that a facsimile transmission will be considered 'delivered' only within 7 days of being sent and standard mail taking 90 days from being sent introduces unreasonable delays that conflict with the general requirement of timely notice, which is against standards of good faith and fair dealing under New York law, the governing law of the agreement.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General standards of good faith and fair dealing under New York contract law

perturbation.original_text: MS hereby grants (subject to any existing third party contractual obligations) to MSCI a non-exclusive, perpetual, irrevocable, world- wide, royalty-free license for MSCI to use, modify, copy, create derivative works of and sublicense, for any business purpose, the MS Licensed Materials.
perturbation.changed_text: MS hereby grants (subject to any existing third party contractual obligations) to MSCI a non-exclusive license for MSCI to use, modify, copy, create derivative works of and sublicense, for any business purpose, the MS Licensed Materials. This license can be terminated by MS at any time with or without cause.
perturbation.explanation: Removing 'perpetual' and 'irrevocable' and adding a termination clause creates an inconsistency. The original language provides a permanent license, while the modified version allows MS to terminate the license at will. This contradicts the concept of a 'perpetual' license, which suggests a permanent right. The modification introduces uncertainty and conflicts with the established understanding of the license agreement and could violate intellectual property law principles.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Intellectual property law principles regarding the nature of perpetual licenses.

perturbation.original_text: This Agreement shall be construed in accordance with and governed by the substantive internal laws of the State of New York. MSCI Inc. is registered to do business in New York under the name NY MSCI.
perturbation.changed_text: This Agreement shall be construed in accordance with and governed by the substantive internal laws of the State of Delaware. MSCI Inc. is not required to be registered to do business in New York.
perturbation.explanation: Changing the governing law from New York to Delaware and stating that MSCI Inc. is not required to be registered to do business in New York introduces legal issues. The original text acknowledges that MSCI Inc. is registered to do business in New York under the name NY MSCI, which implies it has established a presence and conducts business in the state. Changing the text to state that it is not required to be registered to do business in New York contradicts this established fact, which is inconsistent with statutory requirements governing foreign corporations doing business in New York and could result in conflict of laws issues and the agreement being invalid.
perturbation.contradicted_law: New York State laws regarding foreign corporations doing business within the state.
